column4: if you don't use windows except for a few things, I would suggest it
you can ether run samba server or ftp server on your ubuntu system, and the virtual windows can access it through the virtual network
do you mean two different versions of windows?  or are you running vm from your real windows partiton?
you are not going to be able to copy and paste your apps
:) im the one who should apologising for giving you such a hard time this morning
I would suggest making a backup, or image of your windows partition  (if you have room) and installing that in the VM
hmmm kk thats new, how do i do that and I only want my important apps
an image is the complete partition, a backup is a backup
115GB - 40GB for windows (5GB limit on privilege accounts "yeha im evil") / 40GB for ubuntu and the rest is unassigned until i need it
then you wont be able to use imaging easily, if your virtual box is smaller than your windows partition
there must be a way to do this I know virtual box created a C: drive but where the heck is that. I should think if i placed items in there is should show when I start up the windows box?
its "virtual"  that means it doesn't really exist as the same thing to the host
keep in progression getting information overload already l0ol so is there a way around this
